title-group.article-title: USING PARTIAL SMOOTHNESS OF p-1 FOR FACTORING POLYNOMIALS MODULO p

abstract.p: Let an arbitrarily small positive constant Œ¥ less than 1 and a polynomial f with integer coefficients be fixed. We prove unconditionally that f modulo p can be completely factored in deterministic polynomial time if p-1 has a (ln p) O(1) -smooth divisor exceeding p Œ¥ . We also address the issue of factoring f modulo p over finite extensions of the prime field ùîΩ p and show that p-1 can be replaced by p k -1 (k ‚àà ‚Ñï) for explicit classes of primes p.
